result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J Moore

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher J Moore in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS: 

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

AS TO COUNT ONE:  

 Defendant sentenced to serve FOUR MONTHS  in the House of Correction with credit for ZERO days time served. NO Huber privileges. Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of TWO YEARS. Probation to commence at the conclusion of Cou nt TWO.
Conditions:
* All mandatory  charges, victim/witness fees within 2 years or civil judgment 
*RANDOM DRUG TESTING
*MAINTAIN VALID DRIVER'S LICENSE
  NOTE:  Court directs the Clerk of Courts Office to notify the Department of Motor Vehicles that  ZERO DAYS (0 days) REVOCATION should be imposed in this case.

AS TO COUNT TWO: 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 30 days  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for  3 days time served.  No Huber privileges . DEFENDANT REMANDED. 

Court ordered all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges waived due to low income. 

 Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Christopher J Moore in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  
Defendant Christopher J Moore in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher J Moore
Current: 3734 N 10th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206-1234   (Effective: 01-25-2015)
Prior: 3286 N. 25th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206-1234
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
